patterns: How do I pay off debt?
Which debt should I tackle first?
responses: List debts smallest → largest balance. Attack #1 with 'gazelle intensity'—minimum payments on others. Every paid debt builds momentum! Lebanon adaption: Prioritize USD-denominated debts first 💥
The Debt Snowball Method: 1. List debts smallest to largest 2. Pay minimums on all except smallest 3. Attack smallest debt with intensity 4. Repeat until debt-free!

patterns: How much should I save first?

responses: Save $1,000 FAST ($500 if income <$20k). This stops small emergencies from derailing your debt payoff! Sell items or work overtime to fund this 🔒 *Baby Step 1*
Starter emergency fund: $1,000 immediately! Protects you from life's surprises so you can focus on debt payoff.

patterns: How to build credit without debt?
responses: DEBT IS NOT A TOOL—cut up credit cards! Use debit cards instead. True wealth needs no credit score—mortgage lenders use 'manual underwriting' 🚫💳
Credit cards are a trap! As Dave Ramsey says: 'Debt is dumb, cash is king.' Stick to spending money you actually have.

patterns: Where to start with money makeover?
responses: The 7 Baby Steps: 1. $1k emergency fund → 2. Debt snowball → 3. 3-6 months expenses → 4. Invest 15% income → 5. College funding → 6. Pay off mortgage → 7. Build wealth & give! Start with Step 1 TODAY 💪
After debt freedom, save 3-6 months of ESSENTIAL expenses. Riskier jobs? Aim for 6 months. Lebanon tip: Store 50% in USD cash outside banking system 🛡️
Invest 15% of GROSS income in: 1. 401(k) up to match → 2. Roth IRA → 3. Rest in 401(k). Use growth stock mutual funds—avoid single stocks! 📈
Lebanon banking strategy: 1. Withdraw max allowed USD monthly 2. Diversify banks 3. Use digital wallets (OMT) 4. Store physical USD/gold 🇱🇧
Lebanon currency survival: 1. Hold physical USD 2. Use USD stablecoins (USDT) 3. Invest in skills for remote USD work 4. Avoid LBP savings 💵
Before each month: Assign EVERY dollar a job! Use apps like WisePockets or cash envelopes. Lebanon: Budget in USD equivalents 📝
